1534470841_1Kh3qLdTH2QKewUb6cWZa2dMveMT5.body:
> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_437_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): i agree the decentralisation is the future, and zeronet is good example of decentralized web hosting network. Though it is closed network (can not be easily utilised by normal clearnet users who do not have it installed), hardly it can be somehow used by all internet users. I think IPFS having javascript (in browser) implementation which should allow (if i am not wrong) utilising IPFS even regular website visitor will not install IPFS software. Unlike IPFS, the ZeroNet is complete package for decentral. website hosting. I do not know better, though there needs to be more developers for the core Zeronet features and fixing already existing bugs. I am surprised why there is only one or very few developers for Zeronet core.

Build it already!
